Articles.Content: I was just testing a new rover and I just happen to spot a solar eclipse by accident and wanted to share. I also thought it would interesting for others to share their cosmic phenomenons as well.
The Mun is orbiting in the ecliptic plane. That happens literally once every Munar orbit (Munth?)

The Mun is orbiting in the ecliptic plane. That happens literally once every Munar orbit (Munth?)

No need to be a buzz kill I just thought it was cool because it was unplanned is all. I've never seen any date system in KSP though so I do not know specifically when that happened.

The Mun is orbiting in the ecliptic plane. That happens literally once every Munar orbit (Munth?)

Not quite, but close. But anyhow, this is still a cool picture of it, and one that's hard to get - it's in the daytime, planetside, rather than just in orbit.
Awesome when you're landed at Kerbin, a little less awesome when you're in orbit and it cuts your solar panels output and you don't notice because you're still well lit.
This one held up my Kerbin science rover for an afternoon.
Dats "purdy!" lol.. I've seen 2 (accidentally) at KSC since I've started playing a few years ago.

Pretty picture .

Though because of your use of comic sans there will be no Rep for you.

OK, OK, there will be, this time...

Pretty picture .

Though because of your use of comic sans there will be no Rep for you.

OK, OK, there will be, this time...

and what is wrong with comic sans? That's a really nice close up shot I was lucky and was using the non solar generators.

and what is wrong with comic sans?

Comic Sans is the font of Satan. http://bancomicsans.com

It's poorly designed, with terrible kerning, inconsistent letter forms, improper lower-case for a comic font, etc, etc. It's ugly, and should never be used.
